newsitem.title: USA: Elcom sees Q1 net in line with estimates.
newsitem.headline: Elcom sees Q1 net in line with estimates.

text.p: Elcom International Inc on Thursday said it expects its first quarter 1997 earnings to meet First Call analysts' estimates of $0.07 per share.
In the first quarter of 1996, the company reported earnings of $0.04 per share.
The company said it sees first quarter revenues at about $176 million, up from $141 million in the same period one year ago.
Elcom attributed the earnings growth to slightly better than expected margins and strong growth in its United Kingdom group.
U.S. earnings were slightly less than expected because the start of a major contract with a financial services firm was delayed from the first quarter to the second quaarter.
The contract is expected to generate significant revenues in current year, the company said.
Elmore said it expects to release its earnings around May 13.
